reviewText: I came across this set of 5 movies last month and mainly got it to see more of Michael J. Fox, who is in 3 of them: "For Love or Money"(1993, rated PG), "The Secret of My Success"(1987, rated PG-13), and "The Hard Way"(1991, rated R). I was reading his autobiographical bookAlways Looking Up: The Adventures of an Incurable Optimist, which I much enjoyed, but I had not seen a lot of his films so I'm glad I took a chance on this set. Some might consider a weakness of "The Hard Way" and "The Secrets of My Success" to be that they have elements that are very unlikely, but they can be enjoyed as partially being farces. For instance, the ending of "The Hard Way" has an action sequence with Fox and policeman James Woods chasing the bad guy, but it's so over-the-top that the Maltin Movie Guide says it gets "out of control." However, the fact that the sequence switches back and forth between the chase and Fox's ultra-cool movie persona (Fox plays an actor in the movie!) shows that the exaggerated action is done in humor. And while it's true that "For Love or Money" is quite predictable, there's a lot of funny stuff in it and it's got an enjoyable romantic story. However, I did get tired of the endless sexual complications that go on too long in "The Secret of My Success." At any rate, Michael J. Fox's charisma is largely what makes these 3 movies a pleasant experience.As for "Casual Sex"(1988. rated R), the script is probably not going to change your life and is not all that illuminating about sex. Still, the movie is quite engaging and occasionally funny, with 2 good stars in Victoria Jackson and Lea Thompson. And I DID get a rush from seeing their nude backsides at the resort! The only film I didn't enjoy at all was "Career Opportunities"(1991, rated PG-13). In it, a guy working at a Target store gets stuck there overnight with a beautiful girl about 20-ish, and 2 crooks show up that same night. However, it's poorly written and often absurd, and has little purpose other than showing off Jennifer Connelly's good looks.For a little more technical info, all of these movies are shown in widescreen (and all in anamorphic widescreen except "Career Opportunities"), and all have optional English subtitles. "Casual Sex" also has optional Spanish subtitles. The picture and sound quality is decent on all of them. With the audio, all movies are presented in either English or French, four of them in Dolby Digital 2.0, while "For Love or Money" is in Dolby Digital 5.1, although I did not listen to these on a surround sound system so I can't assess that. This set is 4 DVDs, so 3 films have their own DVD, while "For Love or Money" and "The Hard Way" are together on one DVD (I guess it's dual-layered since both have good picture quality).In summary, I enjoyed 4 out of the 5 movies on this MOVIE MARATHON COLLECTION, even though none of them is a truly great film. At any rate, this set is certainly a great value!
summary: Some Good Movies and a Great Value

reviewText: I rate this cause I like watching marathon movies. Three movies come with Michael J. Fox like For Love Or Money, The Secret Of My Success, and The Hard Way. I wish it would have been 5 of Michael J. Fox's movies in this marathon. I have seen all 5 of the movie marathon collection and they turned out to be a great film.
